news_header: Kumbh Mela, the world's largest religious event, saw dozens die in a crowd rush in Prayagraj, India.
news_text: The Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj, India, attracted millions but resulted in dozens of deaths due to a crowd rush before dawn. Estimates of fatalities vary, with reports suggesting at least 15 to 40 deaths. Witnesses described chaos as the crowd surged, crushing the elderly and women. Some roads were reportedly closed, leading to suffocation and loss of consciousness among attendees. The festival, held every 12 years, is a major Hindu pilgrimage where participants perform ritual baths to purify sins. The event spans 45 days and can attract up to 400 million people.
